titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Thomas Wentworth Higginson Collection
titlestmt.author: by Molly Wheeler

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 4, 2019 at 04:04

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection contains correspondence and writings of Thomas Wentworth Higginson. Correspondence consists of autograph letters, signed to various individuals. Writings consist of manuscript writings drafts and notes.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired from various sources. Provenance information was transcribed from catalog cards and is listed at the folder level. Unless otherwise noted, material was a gift of Owen F. Aldis, 1911.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Thomas Wentworth Higginson Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Thomas Wentworth Higginson Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The following material was not found among the collection during processing in 2012 although catalog cards exist: 1) autograph letter signed to "Dear Sir" [unidentified], Worcester [Mass.] February 17, 1861. 2 pages; 2) autograph letter signed to George D. Wells, 1852 February 29, Newburyport, Mass. 4 pages; 3) autograph letter signed to an unidentified correspondent, 1898 September 14, Dublin, NH. 1 page. Agreeing to write an article; 4) one page of his manuscript in the Aldis copy of his Sympathy of Religions , Chicago 1893.

bioghist.head: Thomas Wentworth Higginson (1823-1911)
bioghist.p: Thomas Wentworth Higginson, American Unitarian minister, author, abolitionist, and soldier.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence and writings of Thomas Wentworth Higginson. Correspondence consists of autograph letters, signed to various individuals. Writings consist of manuscript writings drafts and notes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Correspondence, 1852-1907. II. Writings, 1864-1906.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Gift of Reverend K. W. Cameron, 1961

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Gift of James T. Babb, 1959 and Sidney W. Davidson, 1957

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Gift of William H. McCarthy, Jr., 1932

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: All writings are autograph manuscript drafts.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Purchased from Morton on the Alvord and GBF funds, 1960
